data.name: DbServerManager_ProjectHasRelativePathes
data.value:
This project uses relative paths. Relative paths are not adjusted when you import the project into the DBServer.
To change relative paths in Citavi after the import, click "File > Project properties > Paths > Repair paths".
Do you want to continue?

data.name: DbServerManager_UserFeedbackRenameAttachmentsPath
data.value:
Important:
1) Tell all project users to close the project. Only continue when there are no more active users. Doing otherwise can cause data loss.
2) The files in the original folder will not automatically be copied to the new folder. You will need to manually copy the files in Windows Explorer.
Do you want to continue?

data.name: DbServerManager_UserFeedbackRenameProjectName
data.value:
Important:
Tell all project users to close the project. Only continue when there are no more active users. Doing otherwise can cause data loss.
Do you want to continue?

data.value: If you installed the SQL server as a named instance, enter the instance name here. We recommend "CitaviServer" as the instance name. If you installed the SQL server as a standard instance, leave this field blank.

data.name: DbServerManager_Wizard_DataConnectionRunsOtherInfo
data.value: If the SQL server is running on another computer, make sure that connections to the SQL server are allowed there (firewall configuration). If you are not sure, start the DBServer Manager on the computer the SQL server is running on.

data.name: DbServerManager_Wizard_DataConnectionServerRunsOnOther
data.value: The SQL server is running on another computer.

data.value: The application can only be closed after the installation process has completed.

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_CheckInputValues
data.value: Please check the following values and then continue the setup.

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_HintToSqlServer
data.value:
This program uses the original Microsoft Setup in the background to perform the installation.

Follow these steps to continue:
  1. Follow the installation guide for MS SQL Server Express in the Citavi Manual.
  2. In the following text field, enter the path to the Setup.exe in the folder for the extracted Setup files.

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_InputValues
data.value:
Enter the instance name for SQL Server Express.

Why is the instance name important?
Let's say you want to install another program on this computer that uses the SQL server as a database. The instance name helps distinguish between the different SQL server installations. For example, you can then uninstall an SQL Server that only contains Citavi and no other program.

Additional information can be found on the Microsoft website.

We recommend CitaviServer as the instance name.

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_InstanceNameHelp
data.value: The instance name should uniquely identify this SQL server. We recommend using the default name.

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_Welcome
data.value:
Welcome to the Setup for SQL Server Express for use with Citavi.

This program installs and configures Microsoft SQL Server Express. It is not suitable for the Standard or Enterprise version of SQL Server.
This program makes the installation of SQL Server Express easier by asking only for the necessary parameters. If you're an experienced database administrator or have special requirements for the installation, we recommend using the original Microsoft Setup.
Additional information can be found in the Online Manual.

data.name: DbServerManager_CurrentConnectionNotAvailable
data.value: The current connection is currently unavailable.

data.name: DbServerManager_NoDataSourcesAvailable
data.value: All data sources are currently unavailable

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_LicencePathNotFound

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_InstanceNameInvalidCharacters
data.value: The instance name contains the following invalid characters:

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_HintToFirewall
data.value:
This setup program configures the Windows Firewall so that queries from personal and domain networks to the Citavi SQL Server are possible. If you do not perform the firewall configuration, Citavi for DBServer will only work on the local computer.
If you're an experienced Windows administrator or if you have special requirements for the firewall configuration, we recommend using the Windows program "Windows Firewall with Advanced Security".

data.name: DbServerManager_Setup_InputValues2
data.value: Enter the instance name you used during the installation of SQL Server Express.

data.name: DbServerManager_ProjectImport_FoundTitleWithToLongNamesAfterImport
data.value: The import could not be started. Citavi found attachments in the source project whose paths contain more than the Windows maximum of 255 characters. Please change the path to the Attachments folder for the source project to recuce the length of the paths.

data.name: DbServerManager_ProjectImport_SameTargetDirectoryForAttachments
data.value: The Attachments folder for the target project is the same as the Attachments folder for the source project. Please select a different Attachments folder.

data.name: DbServerManager_ToLongPath
data.value:
The path entered contains {0} characters. If the user adds attachments to this project, the file names cannot be more than {1} characters to avoid the Windows limit of 255 characters. We recommend that you choose a shorter path to avoid potential problems while using Citavi.
Do you want to make changes to the path?

data.name: DbServerManager_LoginMode_UserDescription
data.value: Your configuration change will not take effect until SQL Server is restarted. Connect to the server computer and run the SQL Server Configuration Manager. On the left pane, click the node SQL Server Services. Then, on the right pane, right-click SQL Server (instance name). On the shortcut menu, click Restart.
data.comment: TS: First part is official SQL Server speak.

data.name: DbServerManager_LicenseCombinationNotAllowed_Text
data.value: This license combination is not allowed. Please contact
data.comment: JS - review: developers, please don't make split up strings like this! They can be difficult to translate.

data.name: DbServerManager_ConvertC5Db_Info
data.value: Citavi 5 databases were found. You can convert these databases to Citavi 6 format. Select the databases you want to convert. Databases converted to Citavi 6 format can no longer be opened in Citavi 5.

data.name: DbServerManager_ConvertC5Db_ConvertedInfo
data.value: Conversion complete. Click to view protocol.

data.name: DbServerManager_ConvertC5Db_FailedInfo
data.value: Conversion failed. Click to view protocol.

data.name: DbServerManager_ConvertC5Db_NoRightsInfo
data.value: You do not have the permissions needed to perform conversion.

data.name: DbServerManager_ConvertWarning_Text_1
data.value: Warning: for reasons of security before conversion we recommend
data.comment: JS - review: Original: Warnung: Aus Sicherheitsgründen empfehlen wir, vor der Konvertierung

data.name: DbServerManager_ConvertWarning_Hyperlink
data.value: creating a backup for the database
data.comment: JS - review - should not split up strings like this and below! This causes problems for the translators.

data.name: DbServerManager_ConvertWarning_Text_2
data.value:
In addition, conversion is only possible if you are the only user who is connected to the database. If you're working with a local SQL server, all active connections will be disconnected without the users being notified. If the database is in Azure Cloud, please make sure that no other user is working with the database.
Would you like to continue?

data.name: DbServerManager_LicenseCombinationNotAllowed_Hyperlink
data.comment: JS - review: developers, please don't make split up strings like this! They can be difficult to translate.

data.name: ConvertToC6Message
data.value: The selected database is configured for Citavi 5. If you want to work with this version of the DBServer Manager it needs to be converted first. After the conversion, projects can only be opened with Citavi 6. Do you want to convert the database and all projects now?

data.name: DbServerManager_BackupFileDoesNotCorrespondToExpectedFormat
data.value: The file name is not in the expected format of a name followed by a timestamp: "Name YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM-SS.bak"
